bibl.title: Proskynema Inscriptions of a Corporation of Iron-Workers from Hermonthis in the Temple of Hatshepsut in Deir el-Bahari: New Evidence for Pagan Cults in Egypt in the 4th cent. A.D.
bibl.note: Modified version of a paper read at the XIX International Congress of Papyrology, Cairo, 1989. - 4 inscriptions made with a thin kalamos. They are quasi-official protocols of cult gatherings held in the temple by a corporation of craftsmen.
LAJTAR Adam, Proskynema Inscriptions of a Corporation of Iron-Workers from Hermonthis in the Temple of Hatshepsut in Deir el-Bahari: New Evidence for Pagan Cults in Egypt in the 4th cent. A.D.
JJurP 21 (1991) pp. 53-70 et 4 figg. sur 2 pll. d√©pl.
